summary: This is an FBI eGuardian incident report summarizing a phone tip received on March 4, 2023, alleging historical child sexual abuse by Jeffrey Epstein and an associate named 'George Epstein'. The caller, an adult male from West Plains, MO, with a connection to Lindenwold, NJ, made wide-ranging allegations of past abuse, threats, and surveillance. The FBI's Philadelphia Division assessed the complaint and closed it, noting the primary subject (Jeffrey Epstein) was deceased and the caller did not report current abuse.

persons.name: Jefferey Epstein
persons.context: Named by the complainant as a perpetrator who took him to sex parties starting at age 11. Listed as a Subject/Reference in the report.

persons.name: George Epstein
persons.context: Named by the complainant alongside Jeffrey Epstein as someone who took him 'all over the world'. The complainant stated this was likely a fake name. Listed as a Subject/Reference.

persons.name: Melissa Gillbom
persons.context: Name mentioned by the complainant in the context of his trauma. FBI queries (Guardian, Sentinel, DIVS) for this name revealed no results. Listed as a Subject/Reference.

persons.name: Ben Gindville
persons.context: Task Force Officer who ran a search through the Camden County Police RMS system for the complainant on March 6, 2023.

persons.name: Austin Messner
persons.context: FBI employee who created a note regarding a tips query conducted for the named subjects.

connections.description: According to the complainant's allegations, both individuals took him to sex parties and traveled the world with him, implying a collaborative abusive relationship.
Connection is indirect; the complainant mentioned Melissa Gillbom's name in the context of discussing his traumas, which were linked to his allegations against Epstein.

events.title: FBI NTOC receives abuse allegation tip
events.description: At 9:11 PM Eastern Time, an individual called the FBI National Threat Operations Center (NTOC) to report allegations of historical child sexual abuse involving Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: Complainant's alleged encounter with a girl and dog
events.description: The complainant reported that in 2008, a girl came to his door, later returned with a dog, and an incident occurred where the dog was humping the girl. He was then dragged from his apartment by a group of people.

events.title: Camden County Police records search
events.description: Task Force Officer Ben Gindville searched Camden County Police records for the complainant, finding over 20 recent submissions and that the complainant had been transported for psychological assessment.

events.title: FBI closes the incident
events.description: The FBI's Philadelphia Division South Jersey Resident Agency closed the incident, assessing that no mandatory reporting or further investigation was warranted as the complainant was an adult, reported no current abuse, and the primary subject (Epstein) was deceased.

locations: Clarksburg, WV (FBI NTOC location: 1000 Custer Hollow Road)
keyFacts: A 2023 tip to the FBI alleged historical child sexual abuse by Jeffrey Epstein and an associate using the name 'George Epstein', whom the tipster believed was an alias.
The FBI assessed the tip but closed the case, citing that the primary subject (Epstein) was deceased, the complainant was an adult, and no current abuse was indicated.

The complainant made wide-ranging and disjointed allegations, including being taken to sex parties from age 11, being followed by gangs and the Mafia, and threats of rape and murder if he went to police.
FBI database queries for 'Melissa Gillbom', a name mentioned by the complainant, returned no results.
Local law enforcement records indicated the complainant had numerous recent police contacts and had been transported for psychological crisis assessment.
